item.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
item.description:
Contributed as a Matte Painter at Pixomondo for the 2013 blockbuster Star Trek Into Darkness.

The work involved creating large-scale futuristic environments and set extensions, blending digital painting with 3D elements to define the visual scape of the J.J. Abrams sequel.

item.title: Game of Thrones
item.description:
Sebastian worked as a VFX/Environment Artist at Pixomondo for the acclaimed HBO series Game of Thrones.

He was part of the talented team recognized with a Primetime Emmy Award in 2012 for Outstanding Special Visual Effects for Season 2. His work involved creating complex digital environments and seamless integration to bring the world of Westeros to life.

item.title: The Avengers
item.description:
Served as a Senior Lighting and Shading Artist at Scanline VFX, contributing to the complex digital environments of the Marvel blockbuster The Avengers (2012).

The project required precise shading and lighting of digital assets to integrate perfectly with live-action footage during the intense battle sequences.

item.title: Looper
item.description: Worked as a Senior Visual Effects Artist at Scanline VFX for the 2012 sci-fi thriller Looper.

item.title: Innocent Saturday (V subbotu)
item.description: Worked as a lighting and shading artist for this drama centered around the Chernobyl disaster.

item.title: Borgia
item.description: Worked as a Digital Matte Painter and Environment Artist at RISE Visual Effects Studios for the historical TV series Borgia.

item.title: The Last Airbender
item.description: Served as a Digital Matte Artist, creating the epic landscapes for M. Night Shyamalan’s 2010 adaptation The Last Airbender.

item.title: The Ghost Writer
item.description: Provided visual effects for Roman Polanski’s 2010 thriller The Ghost Writer.
Involved in the extensive disaster visual effects that defined the 2009 film 2012.

item.title: Clouds Over the Hill (坂の上の雲)
item.description: Contributed visual effects to Clouds Over the Hill (Saka no Ue no Kumo), a large-scale Japanese historical drama series produced by NHK.
